titles: Restauranda, or, The necessity of publick repairs, by setling of a certain and royal yearly revenue for the king or the way to a well-being for the king and his people, proposed by the establishing of a fitting reveue for him, and enacting some necessary and wholesome laws for the people.
author: Philipps, Fabian, 1601-1690.
publisher: Printed by Richard Hodgkinson ..., and are to be sold by Abel Roper ...,
notes: Dedication reads: Regi et patriae versique honoris et felicitatis Angliae cultoribus, hasce veluti materiarum sedes, dicat dedicatque Fabianus Philipps.
Attributed to Fabian Philipps. Cf. NUC pre-1956.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
